Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient has been busy with work and family but feels alright overall.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient successfully premiered a short film, feeling proud despite initial stress about meeting deadlines. They are also contemplating a documentary on homelessness, wanting to highlight the experiences of those affected.
Psychosocial History: The patient is reflecting on balancing work and family, trying to be more patient with their daughter, and focusing on listening to her.
Current Functional Status: The patient reports improved communication with their daughter, indicating a stronger connection.
Progress Evaluation: The patient feels they are getting better at managing stress and balancing responsibilities, though they still face challenges.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is using strategies like taking breaks, setting work hours, and creating rituals to manage stress and maintain boundaries.
Next Steps: The patient aims to focus on their documentary project and improve time management between work and family in the next session.
